    • newGame

      public void newGame(Controller controller)
      Initializes a new game using the provided controller. Sets the game object obtained from the controller as the current game. Resets the number of connected players to 0.
      Parameters:
      controller - the controller used to start the new game

    • getName

      public String getName(List<User> Lobby)

    • serverInit

      public void serverInit()
      Initializes the server for the game. Starts an RMI server on the port specified in Settings.RMI_PORT. Starts a thread for the socket server. Waits until the number of players in the controller's lobby is equal to the desired number of players. Once the number of players reaches the desired count, starts the game by calling the startGame() method on the controller.

    • getSocketServer

      public SocketServer getSocketServer()

    • getRmiServer

      public RMIServerApp getRmiServer()

    • getController

      public Controller getController()

    • pick

      public boolean pick(String username, List<Coordinates> coordinates)
      method that allows the client to take tiles from the board
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      coordinates - coordinates of the tiles to be taken

    • topUp

      public boolean topUp(String username, int column, int tileIndex)
      remote method that given a column as input, puts the drawn tiles in that column of the player's grid
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      column - Player's Choice Column
      tileIndex -

    • set_player_disconnected

      public void set_player_disconnected(String username)
      Sets a player as disconnected based on the provided username. If the username is not null, it sets the connected status of the corresponding user to false and decrements the count of connected players. This action triggers a listener or event to handle the disconnection.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to be set as disconnected

    • stopKeepAlive

      public void stopKeepAlive(String username, boolean connectionType)

    • join

      public boolean join(String username, boolean connectionType) throws InvalidLoginException
      method for logging in the player through the nickname. The method checks that the nickname is different for each logged in player.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      connectionType - =0 if connection is RMI, =1 if connection is Socket
      Throws:
      InvalidLoginException

    • create_game

      public boolean create_game(String username, boolean connectionType, int numPlayers) throws InvalidLoginException
      method for logging the FIRST player through the nickname.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name
      connectionType - =0 if connection is RMI, =1 if connection is Socket
      numPlayers - Number of players in the match
      Throws:
      InvalidLoginException

    • quit

      public boolean quit(String username)
      method called when a player wants to drop out. A message of the event that occurred is sent to all.
      Parameters:
      username - player's name

    • send

      public void send(VirtualView view)
      Sends the game view to the specified VirtualView. Retrieves the game state from the provided VirtualView and organizes it into various data structures. These include the game board, the point stack, the grid views, the tile views, the personal goal views, and the common goal view.
      Parameters:
      view - the VirtualView to which the game view will be sent

    • refresh

      public void refresh(String playername, VirtualView view)
      Refreshes the game view for a specific player in the provided VirtualView. Retrieves the game state from the VirtualView and organizes it into various data structures, including the game board, the point stack, the grid views, the tile views, the personal goal views, and the common goal view. Constructs a RefreshMsg object with the organized game view data. Send the new view to rmi and socket clients.
      Parameters:
      playername - the username of the player to refresh the game view for
      view - the VirtualView containing the game state

    • send

      public void send(BoardView boardView, TilesView tilesView)
      Sends an update message containing the game board and player's tiles to all connected clients after a successful pick move. Constructs an UpdatePickMsg object with the player's name, tiles, and board. Sends the message to all connected socket clients and rmiClients.
      Parameters:
      boardView - the BoardView containing the game board
      tilesView - the TilesView containing the player's tiles

    • send

      public void send(GridView gridView, TilesView tilesView)
      Sends an update message containing the grid view and player's tiles to all connected clients after a successful top up move. Constructs an UpdateTopUPMsg object with the player's name, tiles, and grid. Sends the message to all connected socket clients and rmiClients.
      Parameters:
      gridView - the GridView containing the grid view
      tilesView - the TilesView containing the player's tiles

    • send

      public void send(ScoreBoardView scoreBoard)
      Sends an update message containing the scoreboard to all connected clients to display final scoreBoard after game has ended. Constructs a ScoreBoardMsg object with the scoreboard data. Sends the message to all connected socket clients and rmiClients.
      Parameters:
      scoreBoard - the ScoreBoardView containing the scoreboard data

    • sendInfo

      public void sendInfo(String info, User user, int identifier)
      Sends an informational message to a specific user. Constructs a PopUpMsg object with the provided information. Sets the identifier for the message. Retrieves the username and connection type from the provided User object. Sends the message to the corresponding socket client or rmi client.
      Parameters:
      info - the information to be sent
      user - reference to the User
      identifier - the identifier for the message

    • sendInfo

      public void sendInfo(String info, int identifier)
      Sends an informational message to all connected clients. Constructs a PopUpMsg object with the provided information. Sets the identifier for the message. Sends the message to all connected socket clients and rmi clients.
      Parameters:
      info - the information to be sent
      identifier - the identifier for the message

    • sendChat

      public void sendChat(String username, String text)
      Sends a chat message to all connected clients. Constructs a ChatMessage object with the provided username and text. Sends the message to all connected socket clients and rmi clients.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the sender
      text - the text of the chat message

    • sendChat

      public void sendChat(String username, String text, String receiver)
      Sends a chat message to a specific connected clients. Constructs a ChatMessage object with the provided username and text.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the sender
      text - the text of the chat message
      receiver - the username of the receiver

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser(String username, boolean connectionType)
      Removes a user from the server based on the username and connection type. If the connection type is socket, disconnects the corresponding socket client and removes it from the socket server's client list. If the connection type is RMI, removes the corresponding RMI client from the RMI server's client list.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to be removed
      connectionType - the connection type of the user (true for socket, false for RMI)

    • turn_Refresh

      public void turn_Refresh(String playername, boolean move)
      Sends a pre-turn message to a specific player indicating their turn refresh. Constructs a PreTurnMsg object with the playername and move information. Sends the message to the corresponding socket client or rmi client.
      Parameters:
      playername - the username of the player
      move - indicates whether the player can make a move in the current turn
